intro: Ruellia makoyana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Ruellia makoyana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
